node.text: A rare feat for a television series about a Black family. Period. Deeply proud of every actor, director, writer, producer, grip, gaffer, scrip sup, post sup, makeup, hair, costume, production design, stunts, editorial, music, sound, medic, transpo, scenic, AD, PA, DP, DIT, VFX, SFX, construction, greensperson, double, background, props, colorist and executive who has lent their talent to this series. It takes a very large and skilled village. People who are not in the limelight. But who are stars to me. My deep gratitude to this team. Check out our work on DVR all week, then catch new episodes on OWN each Tuesday! We are back! xo

node.text:
ARRAY Releasing’s fourth straight NY Times Critics Pick hits @netflix today! Directed by @smithmyth and @gardinerainsley, COUSINS is one of New Zealand’s top films of 2021 and truly stole my heart. So lovingly made and sumptuous in its storytelling. 

This is what the NY Times had to say: “Racism, discriminatory laws and the Maori people’s centuries-long struggle for autonomy bracket the characters’ lives in COUSINS, which trembles with sound, color, feeling and power from an excellent cast.”

We hope you’ll watch and enjoy COUSINS from @arraynow. And my thanks to @tilanej for leading the charge to bring this gem into the ARRAY family. Onward…

node.text: On behalf of everyone who contributed to the vision of @arraynow, we thank the @peabodyawards for this acknowledgment in our tenth anniversary year. And we thank the icon @oprah for introducing the award with such grace and kindness. Onward for all of us. 🤍

node.text: A CONCERTO IS A CONVERSATION is now Academy Award nominated in the Best Short Documentary category. I’m so proud to executive produce this gorgeous work featuring Mr. Horace Bowers and his grandson, Kris. Enjoy this gem co-directed by @krisbowersmusic and @bgproudfoot at the concertodoc.com for your viewing pleasure and voting consideration. xo

node.text: But tonight, these two characters that I love so much will get married. It’s been a long journey for Ralph Angel and Darla. Writing their story over five seasons has been a challenge and a joy. Thanks to @biancajasminelawson and @kofisiriboe for being such magnificent partners in this storytelling. Their talent inspires us all. #QueenSugar

node.text:
On March 11, 2011 - ten years ago today - my comrades and I released my first feature in theaters on our own. Five cities opened on the same day, eventually topping the indie box office that weekend and expanding to a dozen cities. We did it with no money. All indie. With elbow grease, community organizing and love. It’s a blessing to remember the days that make us who we are. This is one of mine. 

The distribution of I WILL FOLLOW by AFFRM is the foundation of what is now @arraynow. A decade of disruption and creating without permission. 

Much love to @tilanej @matthewacherry @gabrielleglorebk @sallirichwhit @omarihardwickofficial @hipcinema @writerjennifer @lyrispect @slminspired @minoliecece @bronzelens who I see in this video, all my family and friends, every ARRAY Maverick and Rebel and each person who came and bought a ticket. You made everything possible. Then and now. #affrmthyself. xo

node.text:
Philando Castile was 32. He worked in food service, feeding teens in the public school system since he himself graduated high school. He was killed by Officer Jeronimo Yanez, 29, on July 6, 2016 in Falcon Heights, MInnesota. 

Our third @leapaction project, which seeks to hold law enforcement officers accountable for their killing of Black people, is a culinary artwork by food activist Jocelyn Jackson. Entitled FIXED PRICE MENU, this conceptual tablescape and meal explore the intersection of two lives ending with one killing the other. 

Officer Jeronimo Yanez, who fired the seven deadly shots at Mr. Castile, has still not been held accountable. 

View the project at leapaction.org. And join us today for a special Community Cooking Session with Jocelyn Jackson (@justuskitchen) via Zoom @ 5 PM PST! Jocelyn will prepare a few recipes from #FixedPriceMenu + show how every meal tells a story. RSVP at HTTP://BIT.LY/LEAPCOOKING!

node.text: Led by an all-women leadership team including @tammykgarnes @regina_mil @coolmoegeek @_iammrsmorgan and @tilanej, ARRAY CREW is now live! Two years of love and labor. Pride isn’t the word for what I feel about what these women have done. What they’ve built with their own hands. Brava to the whole ARRAY Crew team: Natalia, Mychal, Kelsey, Kayla, Santana, Brandon, Abdul, Johnel, Shaun, Quiana, Sergio, David, Andrea and our comrades at @warnerbros for the focus and fortitude you’ve all brought to the project. Learn more about #ARRAYCrew in my interview with @gayleking of @cbsthismorning and help us spread the word. 🖤 #findyourcrew

node.text:
“DuVernay has now commissioned Lofton, 28, to create a visual poem for the Law Enforcement Accountability Project (@leapaction), which @arraynow started in the days after George Floyd’s murder last May in Minneapolis. The project aims to call attention to police brutality, as well as the code of silence that exists around it. In the resulting work, “Would You Kill God Too,” WJ Lofton (@mrjamespoetry) asks a series of questions to three Louisville Metro Police Department officers—Jonathan Mattingly, Brett Hankison and Myles Cosgrove—who conducted a ‘no knock’ warrant raid on Taylor’s apartment late at night on March 13, 2020. During the raid, the officers fired more than thirty shots into her residence, killing her.”
- Andrew R. Chow, @Time Magazine (link in bio)

node.text: A rare feat for a television series about a Black family. Period. Deeply proud of every actor, director, writer, producer, grip, gaffer, scrip sup, post sup, makeup, hair, costume, production design, stunts, editorial, music, sound, medic, transpo, scenic, AD, PA, DP, DIT, VFX, SFX, construction, greensperson, double, background, props, colorist and executive who has lent their talent to this series. It takes a very large and skilled village. People who are not in the limelight. But who are stars to me. My deep gratitude to this team. Check out our work on DVR all week, then catch new episodes on OWN each Tuesday! We are back! xo

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Ava DuVernay on September 06, 2021. May be an image of 2 people, people standing, brick wall and street.

node.text: I remember the times you’d come on set even when you weren’t on the call sheet. Just to share a hug. To cheer us on. Strolling in like the King that you were. For just a flash to give some love - then gone. I remember nights out in NYC that summer and how you were so loved by the folks in your city. I remember our work on the work, always connected and communicating and exacavating and building because you were so open and ready to give your all. I remember you sending me a picture of yourself as a young man and sharing with me that the boys whose story we were telling were a reflection of you - and we were going to get it right. I remember you taking the young actors to the beach on your own and talking to them about things I couldn’t - about being a young, Black man in New York at the time - and how grateful I was. I remember the last text you sent me introducing me to your friend “Ava” that you met Day One in your trailer - and me not believing that you kept your start-of-production orchid for three whole years. I remember you speaking of mortality, like you did in your post last year about Kobe. In it, you wonder how you’ll be remembered and what your legacy will be. Maya Angelou once said, your legacy lives on in every life you touch. You, brother, touched many. Through your personal interactions big and small, through your community activism, through your struggles, through your triumphs, through your glorious work. You moved many. You moved me. What you doubted in life, be certain of now, dear brother. Be certain. You were a flash of love - now gone. But never forgotten.

node.text: “This being human is a guest house. Every morning, a new arrival.” I’m grateful for all my mornings that have led to this birthday. The tough ones. The delightful ones. The ones that required courage. The ones that came with joy as I opened my eyes. I thank God for the contentment, clarity and capacity for hope that I feel today. And I wish the very same for you. xo

node.text: Watching and being close with my grandmother in her mature years is an honor. On this day, her 88th birthday, I pray for her happiness in as many moments as possible. Because we take it day by day. Moment by moment. That’s the way. And I pray for her health of body, mind and spirit. What a woman. Happy birthday to my gorgeous Gram. You are our gift everyday.

node.text: Happy birthday, buddy. Thanks for always making me giggle like a kid. Enjoy your 60th, sir. Now, a little lower key than planned. But no less blessed. May you keep giving and growing and going to places we only imagined - and to places that some were never able to conjure. Respect.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Ava DuVernay on August 03, 2021. May be a black-and-white image of 3 people, child and people standing.

node.text: My great grandmother holds the umbrella. Her sister Flora and Flora’s son, Ashley, surround her. I called her Big Gramma. I remember her hands still. I wish I was older when she was here. So we could really talk. I was just a little girl when she journeyed on. We’ll catch up one day. 🤍

node.text: “Paul Garnes has been my true and trusted partner for the past decade, the one who takes my dreams off the page and makes them a reality on the set and beyond. He's simply the best at what he does and the way that he does it - with warmth and wisdom, gusto and grace. It brings me great joy to work even more closely with Paul as he leads ARRAY Filmworks into a new era with our stellar team.” @paulgarnes  @tilanej @mjcaballero @mongomgar @thereeljade @janaedesire @aure1io @jordanvtyner @yourfriendmaha

node.text: The last time I communicated with this shining star named #LindsayBradford, we DMed and exchanged some love just in June. I kept tabs on her and she kept tabs on me since we worked together on the pilot of #DMZ right before the quarantine began last year. She was a key set PA. She was a light! One of the people that I remembered and carried in my heart after the shoot. I remembered her because she wanted to be a director. She was also interested in acting. She had modeled a little. She was pursuing it all. Traveling her own path. So passionate about everything. I spoke with her mother this morning and Ms. Josita shared, “She always said she wanted to be somebody. I told her she already was.” Indeed. She already was. I only hope she knew that. Lindsay passed away this weekend. Her heart couldn’t fight Covid. I feel she is gone too soon. But her mother reminded me that she lived her life the way she wanted and there are no regrets. Lindsay’s last IG post of herself was standing against a bright blue sky looking fabulous with the caption, “It’s my time.” That was 10 days ago. Now she has journeyed on. But her light continues everywhere. Life is fleeting, my friends. Live yours to the fullest. Try the new thing. Pursue your passion. Don’t be afraid to declare what you want to do, what you want to be or to say that you don’t yet know. Feel free within yourself to stretch and explore. Truly, that is enough. Bless you, Lindsay. I’ll continue to remember you, Sis. And to carry you with me as I go.

node.text:
ARRAY Releasing’s fourth straight NY Times Critics Pick hits @netflix today! Directed by @smithmyth and @gardinerainsley, COUSINS is one of New Zealand’s top films of 2021 and truly stole my heart. So lovingly made and sumptuous in its storytelling. 

This is what the NY Times had to say: “Racism, discriminatory laws and the Maori people’s centuries-long struggle for autonomy bracket the characters’ lives in COUSINS, which trembles with sound, color, feeling and power from an excellent cast.”

We hope you’ll watch and enjoy COUSINS from @arraynow. And my thanks to @tilanej for leading the charge to bring this gem into the ARRAY family. Onward…

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Ava DuVernay in New Orleans, Louisiana with @joybeezy, @arraynow, @paulgarnes, @cowwmonster, and @realhenrysimmons. May be an image of 2 people and text that says 'DEADLINE BREAKING NEWS ALERT JULY 07, 2021 Henry Simmons & Joy Bryant Το Star In Season 2 Of OWN Anthology Drama Series 'Cherish The Day' ERCON'.

node.text: Our second season of CHERISH THE DAY begins principal photography today with a gorgeous @arraynow crew and Joy Bryant and Henry Simmons as the new leads. Set in New Orleans, our romance anthology created by yours truly will be directed by @angelkristiwms + @sheldoncandis from scripts by two of my favorite showrunners @teri.schaffer and @rayneswilling and their stellar writers room. More incredible cast to be announced soon. Thrilled to begin again. Onward!
